metadata.title: CVE-2021-47055 linux
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:  mtd: require write permissions for locking and badblock ioctls  MEMLOCK, MEMUNLOCK and OTPLOCK modify protection bits. Thus require write permission. Depending on the hardware MEMLOCK might even be write-once, e.g. for SPI-NOR flashes with their WP# tied to GND. OTPLOCK is always write-once.  MEMSETBADBLOCK modifies the bad block table.
